dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and she gave two different figures, right? The solidarity pension for people with pre-1998 work experience is 62,700 tenge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and she gave two different figures, right? The solidarity pension for people with preminus nineteen ninety eight work experience is sixty two thousand, seven hundred tenge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She explained that the minimum pension for citizens with work experience prior to 1998 is currently 62,700 tenge, referring to the minimum solidarity pension.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then there's the basic minimum pension for everyone, even without a work history—that's only 32,300 tenge, which is like 70 percent of the subsistence minimum.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then there's the basic minimum pension for everyone, even without a work history-that's only thirty two thousand, three hundred tenge, which is like seventy percent of the subsistence minimum.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If we're talking about the basic minimum pension, it is provided to all citizens, including those without employment history. Its amount equals 70 percent of the subsistence minimum, or 32,300 tenge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which, uh, honestly, that second number seems incredibly low. I can't imagine living on that, especially in a city.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, uh, honestly, that second number seems incredibly low. I can't imagine living on that, especially in a city.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And when they pressed her on whether it's enough for food, utilities, transport… she kinda deflected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And when they pressed her on whether it's enough for food, utilities, transport... she kinda deflected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When asked directly whether this amount is enough to meet everyday needs such as food, utilities, and transport, Shegai responded: In terms of adequacy, pensions are always tied to the employment income a person received before retirement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, she said it depends on the person and the region, and tied it back to their previous income. Which, like, doesn't really answer the question.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, she said it depends on the person and the region, and tied it back to their previous income. Which, like, doesn't really answer the question.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Within my area of responsibility, I've provided the current pension amounts. But ultimately, it depends on the individual and the region where they live, she said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It feels like she's avoiding saying outright that it's not sufficient. I mean, 32,000 tenge—what is that, like 70 bucks?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It feels like she's avoiding saying outright that it's not sufficient. I mean, thirty two thousand tenge-what is that, like seventy bucks?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Something like that. And she mentioned it's part of a multi-tier system, so maybe there are other payments, but still…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Something like that. And she mentioned it's part of a multi-tier system, so maybe there are other payments, but still...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan has a multi-tier pension system, and budget-funded pension payments are only one component of the total pension, Shegai said during a government briefing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But if that's the base, it's worrying. Especially for those without any work history. They're just stuck with that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But if that's the base, it's worrying. Especially for those without any work history. They're just stuck with that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And she did mention the average pension is higher, but averages can be misleading, you know? If some pensions are huge, it drags the number up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And she did mention the average pension is higher, but averages can be misleading, you know? If some pensions are huge, it drags the number up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. I'd be curious to know the median instead. That would tell us more about what most retirees are actually living on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. I'd be curious to know the median instead. That would tell us more about what most retirees are actually living on.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's one of those things where the official numbers don't always reflect reality on the ground.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's one of those things where the official numbers don't always reflect reality on the ground.
